reviewText: One of the best documentary about current Hong Kong.

This is an excellent documentary of Hong Kong recent politics and of 2 young men trying to make a difference. The director follows the daily lives of Joshua Wong (2014 Times Magazine Person of the Year nominee) and Mai Ja. 2 young men who have 2 very different approaches to political reforms with the same goal, to bring true democracy and universal suffrage to Hong Kong. It is a very inspiring story of what young teenagers can do in our society. This is a must buy for all.
